result.execSummary:
The defendant Aron S Arvelo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Invade Privacy - Use Surveillance Device, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.08(2)(a).
  • Invade Privacy - Use Surveillance Device, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.08(2)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Hearing 8/13/2014 at 8:30 a.m.

****8-25-14 Judge Dugan, Court ordered defendant to pay restitution to: Hannah B. in the sum of $674.88; Katherine E. in the sum of $800.84. Defendant has until December 2017 to pay each victim. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment ****

Provide DNA sample.
AS TO EACH COUNT:  pay mandatory DNA surcharge, and all other costs, penalties and surcharges during probation and/or to be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and during Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Seek and maintain fulltime  employment. Vocational/educational training.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No contact with victims KME, MK or HB.
Not to possess any device capable of recording pictures or video.

Sex offender assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Cognitive behavior therapy.
Pay supervision fees.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

Court informs defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Pursuant to 973.046, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC for 15 years.

timeConds.notes: No good time credit.  STAYED to be used as sanctions, straight time:  to serve 90 days for first violation, balance  for second.

supervisions.notes: AS TO COUNTS THREE, FOUR AND SIX:  Pay DNA surcharge, all other costs, etc as listed/ordered  on count one.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for seven (7) days.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for zero days.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for zero days.

Regarding Restitution signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant to pay restitution to:
-Hannah B. in the sum of $674.88;
-Katherine E. in the sum of $800.84.
Defendant has until December 2017 to pay each victim.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Attorney Susan Marie Roth in court, defendant Aron S Arvelo not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant not produced.  Case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 10.  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Count one.
Counts three, four and six.

Defendant Aron S Arvelo in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and defendant.  Additional statements made by Hannah B. and Katherine E.
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3.5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0days time served.; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Sex offender assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety
*No contact with victims KME, MK and HB.
*Random urine screens. 
*Seek and maintain  fulltime employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Not to possess any device cabable of recording pictures or video
*Pay supervision fees.
The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years with the following conditions:
*Defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction.  No good time credit.  Court stayed sentence to be used as sanctions.  Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days STRAIGHT time for 1st violation and balance as STRAIGHT time for 2nd violation.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Sex offender assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety
*No contact with victims KME, MK and HB.
*Random urine screens. 
*Seek and maintain  fulltime employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Not to possess any device cabable of recording pictures or video
*Pay supervision fees.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The court ordered defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 7 days time served.  

AS TO COUNT 4:
The court ordered defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.  

AS TO COUNT 6:
The court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.  

As to count 1: Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample.
As to each count: Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
As to each count: Defendant ordered to pay DNA SURCHARGE and all other costs, penalties and surcharges during probation and/or to be collected by the DOC from 25% of prison funds and during extended supervision.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC for 15 years.
Restitution to be determined.
Case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 10.

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment

Defendant Aron S Arvelo in court with attorney Susan M Roth.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The victim in this case will be out of town and wishes to appear for sentencing.  State's motion to adjourn sentencing is granted.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 10.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-16-2014 at 08:30 am.

ADA Karshen phoned to reschedule sentencing to allow victim to be present stating Attorney Roth has no objection.  Case adjourned to 6-6-2014 at 8:30 a.m. for motion to adjourn in Branch 10.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dugan, Br. 10.

Defendant Aron S Arvelo in court with attorney Susan M Roth.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNTS 1, 3, 4 AND 6:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 5:
State's motion to dismiss and read-in counts 2 and 5 granted by the court.
Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 44.
All parties notified as of August 03, 2014 this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44, in Room 506 of the Safety Bldg.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Br 12 is in trial.  Br 10 will hear this matter for Br 12.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
JusticePoint report received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defendant Aron S Arvelo in court with attorney Susan M. Roth.  Defendant Aron S Arvelo in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor counts 3, 4, 5 and 6.
Defendant has retained private counsel.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
